pr_title: GH-2442 improve performance for sorting literals with datatype by introducing an enum for known types

timeline.message:
GH-2442 introduce xsd enum

Signed-off-by: Håvard Ottestad <hmottestad@gmail.com>

create all literals with correct enum

Signed-off-by: Håvard Ottestad <hmottestad@gmail.com>

timeline.bodyText: Is this separate boolean flag necessary? You could just do this with a simple null check, right?
timeline.author: jeenbroekstra

replies.bodyText: removed now that we've moved to optionals
replies.author: hmottestad

timeline.bodyText: I agree with you that use of Optional is better here (especially if it makes no difference in performance) - it will also make some of your usage code a bit more fluent. Btw the public modifier is redundant here (and on everything else in this interface as well I guess).
timeline.author: jeenbroekstra

replies.bodyText: Naming: as with the class name, I dislike having the type in the method name. Can we call the method getXmlDatatype instead?
replies.author: jeenbroekstra

replies.bodyText: I've gone with getXsdDatatype() which aligns with having Datatype be an enum within the XSD class.
replies.author: hmottestad

replies.bodyText: I've also moved to using Optional.
replies.author: hmottestad

timeline.bodyText: You will need to remove this before merging.
timeline.author: jeenbroekstra

timeline.bodyText: I really dislike having the Enum suffix on the class name. How about we move this enum to an inner type of XSD and call it Datatype instead? You'd refer to it as XSD.Datatype.DURATION etc.
timeline.author: jeenbroekstra

replies.bodyText: I followed your recommendation here and it looks pretty decent. Thanks!
replies.author: hmottestad

timeline.message:
skipping instanceof makes everything much faster

Signed-off-by: Håvard Ottestad <hmottestad@gmail.com>

more use of xsd enum

Signed-off-by: Håvard Ottestad <hmottestad@gmail.com>

timeline.bodyText: Pre-calculation of new ValueComparator().compare(d1, d2) for all datatype combinations.
timeline.author: hmottestad

timeline.message:
fix test and cleanup

Signed-off-by: Håvard Ottestad <hmottestad@gmail.com>

bug fix and optimisations

Signed-off-by: Håvard Ottestad <hmottestad@gmail.com>

remove lookup table

Signed-off-by: Håvard Ottestad <hmottestad@gmail.com>
GH-2442 use optionals and some code cleanup and renaming

added another benchmark

Signed-off-by: Håvard Ottestad <hmottestad@gmail.com>

timeline.bodyText: Spelling: it should be isBNode (capital N)
timeline.author: jeenbroekstra

timeline.bodyText: I suggest we move these defaults to Value instead, and then have each sub-interface override only the one for which the result should be true.
timeline.author: jeenbroekstra

replies.bodyText: I prefer to have Value have functional defaults (eg. instanceof), but it wouldn't actually make a difference I think.
replies.author: hmottestad

timeline.author: jeenbroekstra

timeline.bodyText: It's a little odd to be using an Optional value that can also be null. I understand why it's done (and the comment also explains it well), but to make it glaringly obvbious perhaps initialize the value as null here as well, explicitly.
timeline.author: jeenbroekstra
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -54,6 +54,12 @@
 	 */
 	private IRI datatype;
 
+	// The XSD.Datatype enum that matches the datatype IRI for this literal. This value is calculated on the fly and
+	// cached in this variable. `null` means we have not calculated and cached this value yet. We are not worried about
+	// race conditions, since calculating this value multiple times must lead to the same effective result. Transient is
+	// only used to stop this field from be serialised.
+	transient private Optional<XSD.Datatype> xsdDatatype;
